label: 女院
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Nyōin was a title of respect sometimes conferred by an Emperor on his mother, his sister, or a woman of comparable standing--usually someone who had previously been granted equality with the three Empresses" (jusangū).  [准三宮]"
